text.p: Shares of Interlink Computer Sciences Inc fell Wednesday after the company warned the transition into a cooperative selling arrangement with Cisco Systems is taking longer than expected.

"We anticipate another quarter or two before the program is fully implemented, and as a result, will affect our growth in FY 98 revenue and earnings," the company said. "We expect product licenses to grow in the 30 percent to 40 percent range and the overall revenue to grow in the 15 percent to 20 percent range."
Shares of the supplier of enterprise networked systems management, were off 2-1/8 to 4-7/8 in midmorning trade.

For the quarter ended June 30, 1997, Interlink reported net income of $687,000, or $.08 per share, compared with net income of $407,000, or $0.08 per share, in the fourth quarter of fiscal 1996. Revenues were $10.3 million, a slight increase over revenues for the same period a year ago.
